question.title: How can I change uploaded files directory in play 2.0.1?

node.contents: I tried to specify attachments.path property in my application.conf file, but this had no effects.

astNode.text: I tried to specify attachments.path property in my application.conf file, but this had no effects.

node.contents: In the documentation of play 2.0.1 I didn't find anything explaining how to change uploaded files directory.

astNode.text: In the documentation of play 2.0.1 I didn't find anything explaining how to change uploaded files directory.

node.contents:
Thank for your response, Marcus, but this did not solve my problem. I have to control the folder in which 
<picture in="" your="" example="">
  reside. However, I solved the problem by starting the app with target/start -Djava.io.tmpdir=
 <my tmp="" folder="" path=""></my>
</picture>

node.contents: Oh you didn't specify that you need to control tmp dir :) Thanks for tip, however you can still use my sample to save uploaded file from tmp to exacto location on disk.
